subject: Re: [junit] Re: [TEST] JTest v4.5 and what is says about JUnit
msgSnippet: What exactly does the @pre tag do? Does it test that the method fails if called with an invalid value? ...
messageBody:
What exactly does the @pre tag do? Does it test that the method fails if called with an invalid value?

> --- In junit@y..., "rxqch" <rxqch@y...> wrote:
> > Hi, I work with parasoft tech support and the answer to the
> question
> > below is yes. One can use an @pre tag in javadoc to find such
> > problems.
> >
> > Carson
> >
> > --- In junit@y..., Ilja Preuß <ilja.preuss@w...> wrote:
> > > > The problem is that I don't know if there was a problem with
> > > > the input, the processing or something random. If your code
> > > > returns an IllegalArgumentException, then I have a much
> > > > better idea of the issues.
> > >
> > > If you are on the same team, you could ask him. Possibly you
> could
> > even
> > > find out by simply looking at the code and/or the JUnit tests.
> > >
> > > One point I find more critical is that invalid input should be
> > > fail-fast. If a method fails because you provided invalid input
> to a
> > > prior method call, such problems are really hard to find. Can
> JTest
> > help
> > > with such issues?
> > >
> > > Regards, Ilja
>
>
>
>
